articles.author: Janis Laizans
articles.description: Rivers were still spilling banks in the Czech Republic, while the River Danube was rising in Slovakia and Hungary, and flooding has also affected Austria.
articles.title: Poland fortifies towns as deadly floods afflict central Europe

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Vietnam is preparing for more flooding with a tropical depression forecast to strengthen into a storm as it heads to its central coast, days after typhoon Yagi set off floods and landslides that killed more than 290 people in the north.
articles.title: Vietnam braces for another storm as Yagi typhoon death toll surpasses 290

articles.author: Andy Sullivan, Helen Coster, Tim Reid, Richard Cowan
articles.description: Two months after Donald Trump narrowly survived an assassination attempt, a gunman hid undetected for nearly 12 hours on the edge of the golf course where Trump played on Sunday under the protection of an agency that is being pushed to its limits.
articles.title: New apparent Trump assassination attempt highlights Secret Service strains

articles.author: Makini Brice, Tassilo Hummel
articles.description: Dominique Pelicot, the Frenchman accused of drugging his wife and recruiting dozens of strangers to rape her over a decade, on Tuesday admitted to the various criminal charges he faces and begged his family's forgiveness, French media reported.
articles.title: Frenchman accused of mass abuse of wife says "I am a rapist", seeks forgiveness - media

articles.author: Gerry Doyle, Mike Stone
articles.description: The United States is amassing an arsenal of abundant and easily made anti-ship weapons as part of American efforts to deter China in the Indo-Pacific region and gear up U.S. forces there.
articles.title: US strategy for anti-ship weapons to counter China: plentiful, mobile, deadly

articles.author: Kate Abnett
articles.description: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen is set to assign jobs in the EU's executive body on Tuesday, confirming which countries' representatives will win powerful roles on trade, competition and the green agenda.
articles.title: Von der Leyen set to name European Commission's new top team

articles.author: Sarah Marsh
articles.description: Squeezed out of top-level politics by his arch party rival Angela Merkel more than two decades ago, Friedrich Merz is on course to land his first ever government job: as Germany's next chancellor.
articles.title: Friedrich Merz:CDU leader sets sights on becoming German chancellor

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Tuesday that an order by President Vladimir Putin to transform Russia's army into the second largest in the world was needed to address growing threats on Russia's western borders and instability to the east.
articles.title: Kremlin says Russian army expansion needed to address growing threats on western flank
France uses tough, untested cybercrime law to target Telegram's Durov

articles.author: Felix Light
articles.description: Georgian lawmakers on Tuesday approved the third and final reading of a law on "family values and the protection of minors" that would impose sweeping curbs on LGBT rights.
articles.title: Georgian parliament approves law curbing LGBT rights
